title: Westcott Optical Spot by Lindsay Adler: Features & Tutorial
summary: Photographer Lindsay Adler introduces the Westcott Optical Spot, a lighting modifier designed for precise control and creative effects. She details its interchangeable mounts, lens compatibility, built-in shutters, and gobo usage for creating sharp patterns or slices of light.

steps.action: Demonstrate the interchangeable mount system, showing how to unscrew the base to switch between mounts like Profoto, Bowens, Elinchrom, etc.
Explain the included 150mm f/3.5 lens, designed for sharp focus and tight slices of light without chromatic aberration.
Show how to swap the included lens for any standard EF mount lens (e.g., 24-70mm) to change the spread of light.
Use the built-in leaves (shutters) to cut the light into specific shapes like squares or thin slices.
Insert a metal gobo into the gobo holder and slide it into the unit to project patterns.
Adjust the lens focus to create either razor-sharp edges or soft, defocused pockets of light.
Review the kit contents: mount, base with shutters, lens, 8 gobos, 5 gels, and a gel holder.
Address FAQs regarding compatibility with different light brands and the ability to use both strobes (up to 600Ws) and constant lights.

key_takeaways: The Optical Spot features an interchangeable mount system compatible with major lighting brands (Profoto, Bowens, Elinchrom, Broncolor, etc.).
It comes with a high-quality 150mm lens but accepts any EF mount lens for versatility.
Built-in shutters allow for precise shaping of light slices without needing external tape or foil.
The unit works with both constant lights and strobes (rated for up to 600Ws to prevent overheating).
Focus control allows users to choose between sharp, defined patterns or soft, organic textures.
